text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Kuwait's press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Iran's President Khatami appoints a friend of Arabs as head of his office; Mohammad Ali Abtahi named office manager.
- Kuwait urges Washington to put pressure on Israel to halt "extreme" measures against Palestinians.

- Gulf Arab foreign ministers to meet in Riyadh to discuss Middle East peace process and Qatar's plan to host November Middle East and North Africa economic summit. Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates have said they would boycott it to protest against what they see as Israel's failure to advance peace talks.

- Kuwait Crown Prince and Prime Minister Sheikh Saad al-Abdulla al-Sabah receives Foreign Minister Sheikh Sabah al-Ahmad al-Sabah in London. Sheikh Sabah has been running government as acting prime minister since March when Sheikh Saad flew to Britain for medical treatment after emergency colon surgery.
- Kuwait studying plan to develop and reorganise industrial sector.
- Kicking habit before it kicks you: Heath Ministry has recently revived unique programme to help smokers quit.
- Man sentenced to seven years in prison for raping a minor.
